The Football Transfer Sources Reliability Guide

Football Transfer Source Reliability Tiers

Tier 1 – Almost undisputed when discussing a Transfer Rumour. They may not be the first to discuss a rumour, but if they are talking about it; then it is almost certainly true, and possibly close to complete.
Tier 2 – Known to have current sources, but are still fallible and just short of being considered an authority on rumour discussions. However, multiple individuals or sources from this tier reporting the same rumour may indicate a strong possibility of truth to the rumour.
Tier 3 – Unreliable, and not to be trusted solo. They fall into near click-bait practices and are often fighting for relevance in a sea of rumours.
Tier 4 – Not to be trusted at all. These companies make money out of ensuring that you read them and they will make up anything to get you to harness advertising revenue.
Tier 5 – Don’t waste your time reading them




(credit: false 9)

Leo Duarte’s performances against Novara and Monza revealed a serious flaw in Milan’s squad and they are now looking to buy a centre-back. Stefano Pioli needs a reliable player who can alternate with the current starters.

According to SportMediaset, as cited by Milanlive.it, Duarte is expected to leave Milan before the transfer window closes. The next destination hasn’t been found yet but the Rossoneri are working on it in order to sign a new centre-back.

åˆå‚³milenkovic


Paolo Maldini and Ricky Massara, the directors, want to buy a player that already knows Serie A well. Fiorentina duo Nikola Milenkovic and German Pezzella are two players on the list, but the price tags are too high for the time being.

Therefore, they are evaluating other options as well and it remains to be seen who they will make a move for. In any case, it’s clear that a centre-back is needed and Pioli should get the reinforcement he needs.

Juve-Suarez, last updates. Dzeko is still an option

Suarez transfer is a race against time: the Uruguayan striker in the next week should take the Italian exam, which is mandatory for acquiring a European passport. But time is running out, Juve knows it. It could pass even more time before the Pistolero becomes 'sign-able', and he has yet to reach an agreement with Barcelona for the termination of his contract. The risk is that the Juventus will end the transfer market without the certainty of having him in the squad.


This is why the bianconeri keep the track that leads to Edin Dzeko alive: if the situation with the Bosnian were to unblock, Juve could decide to close the deal to give Pirlo the requested striker as soon as possible. In this sense, however, there have been no steps forward between Roma and Napoli for the transfer of Milik in the capital, which could unlock the Dzeko deal. They are also monitoring the Cavani situation, but in the last few hours, there has been a meeting between the striker's entourage and Atletico Madrid managers, who are pushing for him.

Finally, some Arab and Chinese clubs have asked for information on Douglas Costa: it remains to be seen whether the Brazilian is interested in these proposals.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/juve-suarez-last-updates-dzeko-is-still-an-option

Roma-Manchester United: agreement for Smalling nearing the finish line

Chris Smalling is moving ever closer to Roma with the player and club in agreement, and the deal with Manchester United reaching its final stages. Smalling appeared in 37 matches for Roma while on loan from United. Smalling has pushed for the deal to return to Roma. Negotiations are nearing the finish line thanks to Smalling's efforts in the deal's favor, he is now approaching a return to Roma.

Villarreal make inquiry with Juventus over De Sciglio

While on the incoming transfers front the focus is on finding a new striker, Juventus could see some departures in their defence. A possible name on the departure list is that of full-back Mattia De Sciglio.

The 28-year-old is in fact in the radar of Villarreal, who has made an inquiry with the Bianconeri for De Sciglio. After the injury of left-back Alberto Moreno, the Spanish club is looking for a new player in that position and intial contacts between parties have already happened as Villarreal want to assess the feasibility of a potential deal.

El Shaarawy set to return to Europe on loan until January: the possible scenarios

El Shaarawy has been given permission to reach an agreement on a loan deal with a European club, the agreement could be extended or converted to a permanent deal. The player's preference is to return to Roma, who are however covered in his role even with Zaniolo's injury, there have also been some contacts with Arsenal, Atletico Madrid and Paris St Germain, who also recently signed Florenzi. At the moment there is no ongoing negotiation, but El Shaarawy could be an opportunity numerous clubs explore.

Genoa reignites Pjaca interest while closing in on Karsdorp: the latest

Badelj from Lazio, Goldaniga from Sassuolo, Melegoni from Atalanta, Caso from Arezzo and the official signing of Zajc from Fenerbahce. This has been a very busy Sunday on the transfer market for Genoa, who does not intend to slow down. The rossoblù club, in fact, is trying again for Pjaca (a player they've courted for some time) with Juventus, while they plan to shortly close for Karsdorp and there's also confidence in the arrival of Juan Jesus. Ligue 1 club Lyon have agreed a deal with Premier League side Aston Villa to sell them Burkina Faso international winger Bertrand Traoré for €19m, according to RMC Sport.

Freiburg increase offer for Baptiste Santamaria (Angers)

Sky Germany report tonight that Bundesliga side SC Freiburg have submitted another offer for 25-year-old French midfielder Baptiste Santamaria from Ligue 1 side Angers.

The French club have already rejected an initial approach of around €11 million from Freiburg with Angers asking for a fee close to €15m.

Per the report, Santamaria has already reached an agreement in principle with Freiburg whilst a total agreement could be reached in the coming days.

Schalke reach agreement in principle with Gonçalo Paciência

Sport1 report this evening that Schalke and reached an agreement in principle with Portuguese striker Gonçalo Paciência from fellow Bundesliga club Eintracht Frankfurt.

S04 hope to conclude a deal for the striker before Friday’s game vs Bayern Munich.

Sky Sports report tonight that Bayer Leverkusen winger Leon Bailey would like to move to the Premier League with both Everton and Tottenham Hotspur showing an interest.

The 23-year-old has three years remaining on his contract and after losing both Kevin Volland to AS Monaco and Kai Havertz to Chelsea already this summer, Bayer Leverkusen would be reluctant to let another first team attacker leave the club.

Rennes’ initial demands to Chelsea were €40m + the free loan of Olivier Giroud for Édouard Mendy

L’Équipe report that Ligue 1 side Rennes started the negotiating with Chelsea for 28-year-old goalkeeper Édouard Mendy at €40m + the free loan of 33-year-old French international striker Olivier Giroud.

The transfer of Mendy to Chelsea, although not yet concluded, is a question of when and not if. The final fee is expected to be €28m including bonuses.

Manchester United do not have a sell-on percentage fee clause for Memphis Depay, but would have received €3m from Lyon in the event that he signed a contract extension with OL. Fee from Barça is €25m now, €5m end of the season, €2m in bonuses. (De Telegraaf)
St Étienne have formally rejected Leicester City's €29m offer for Wesley Fofana, according to @ManuLonjon .

Amiens in talks to sign free agent full-back Jon Flanagan

France Football report that 27-year-old English full-back Jon Flanagan is in talks about a possible free transfer move to Ligue 2 club Amiens.

Hertha BSC to sign Jhon Córdoba for €9 million & Ondrej Duda

27-year-old Colombian striker Jhon Córdoba was absent from FC Köln training on Tuesday morning to finalise his move to fellow Bundesliga club Hertha Berlin.

According to Kicker, Córdoba will sign a four-year contract with the Berlin club and will undergo a medical. Per the report, FC Köln will receive €9 million and 25-year-old midfielder Ondrej Duda in exchange.

According to Sport1, Duda will arrive in Köln on Tuesday and will undergo a medical check with the Billy Goats on Wednesday.

Córdoba asked to sit out of FC Köln’s DFB Pokal game on Saturday to avoid picking up a potential injury that could see him miss out on a move.

LEICESTER NOT GIVING UP ON TARKOWSKI

Leicester have not given up on signing James Tarkowski from Burnley.

There has been consistent contact between the clubs, Sky Sports News has been told, but they remain apart on a valuation for the centre-back, who has been the subject of rejected bids from West Ham.

Leicester boss Brendan Rodgers wants to add another central defender before the deadline. He has been interested in Tarkowski since Harry Maguire was sold to Manchester United last year.

The claim comes from The Athletic, who today reported that Klopp has asked for one or two more signings to be completed despite financial restrictions imposed by the coronavirus pandemic.

Rennes continue to seek to include Fikayo Tomori loan in Édouard Mendy deal

Contrary to reporting across Europe, there is still no agreement between Rennes and Chelsea for the transfer of Senegalese international goalkeeper Édouard Mendy, with the Ligue 1 club still seeking to insert the loan of Fikayo Tomori in their agreement with Chelsea, according to L’Équipe.

Chelsea, who began negotiations for Mendy over two weeks ago, have been granted permission to speak with the player’s entourage yesterday, which signifies the fact that these marathon talks are finally set for a positive conclusion.

Sources tell Get French Football News that Rennes will now accept €28m including bonuses plus the loan of Tomori. The English international has other opportunities in the Premier League, notably with Everton, but a move to Rennes would give him exposure to the Champions’ League.

Jeff Reine-Adélaïde has decided he wants to move to Rennes

L’Équipe report that French youth international attacking midfielder Jeff Reine-Adélaïe has decided that he wants to move to Rennes to play Champions’ League football and quit Lyon before the transfer window is over.

OL are seeking €30m excluding bonuses in order to part with the ex-Angers and Arsenal man, bu SRFC are not currently disposed to make such an offer, and have already had several bids rejected by Les Gones for JRA.

Rennes are now looking at including players in part exchange in an eventual deal – the question is, would this be something that Lyon would be willing to consider.

One to watch in the coming days for a player that OL paid €25m + €2.5m in bonuses for just last summer.
